title: Installation issue: hwloc
body:
On cori@NERSC and theta@ALCF, #7483 introduced a build regression.

    if '@2.0.0:' in self.spec:
        args.append('--enable-netloc')

netloc requires MPI, yet `hwloc` does not have an MPI dependency because it is commonly depended upon by MPI implementations (e.g., OpenMPI and at least one version of mpich- #15302).

Here is the debug log:

[tau.gcc@8.3.0.log](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4423263/tau.gcc%408.3.0.log)

### Spack version
    $ spack --version
        0.14.1-411-5f308daf0

    $ git branch -v
        develop c3c057f2b package: update flit and py-pyelftools versions (#15817)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

    $ spack install hwloc@2.1.0%gcc@8.3.0~cairo~cuda~gl+libxml2~nvml+pci+shared

NB: This is the variant used by `tau` which is what I was actually installing.

### Platform and user environment

    $ uname -a
        Linux cori04 4.12.14-150.47-default #1 SMP Wed Dec 18 15:05:52 UTC 2019 (8162e25) x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

    $ lsb_release -d
        Description:	SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 15

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
